Interesting place, good fun. We enjoyed spending an hour or two at this place. Would recommend on a rainy day :) quite a wide range of machines for everyone to have good fun. All machines can be tried with entrance fee.

Cool place to check out and kill a few hours. Visited this place cause I had a couple of hours to kill...well worth it. Time flew playing a few old favourites like South Park and Simpsons.
Worth while checking out if you have the time.

Absolute Blast!. I loved this place! Unlimited pinball games for a reasonable entrance fee. There were so many interesting machines with every theme you could think of. It was also neat to see the machines in a subterranean space with exposed brick arches. The whole place was perfect and just so cool. I had a blast playing for what seemed like hours. The staff was incredibly nice and friendly too! This was truly a unique experience and I urge everyone to check it out. You will not be disappointed.
Good fun. So cheap for unlimited play. So many machines and so interesting reading all the statistics about the machines. Easy to find and great for a rainy day :) ☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️☁️

For pinball and arcade video game fans.. This arcade has so many pinball games and video games. The admission price is cheap by US standards. If you have time in Budapest it would be worth stopping by for a few hours.
Coolest ever. This was a awesome place even though I am not a pinball expert. The entrance fee is very low since you can play as much you want.

Crazy Fun Night. For one price you can spend the entire night playing. It costs between 9 & 10 US dollars/person. There are literally more pinball machines then you can play in one night. All of the classic ones are there. This was just a ton of fun. We took public transport to get there and it was quite easy. We took the yellow tram that travels along the Danube to the end of the line and then just walked about 6 blocks to get there.

Pin Ball Wizards Unite, this rocks. What a great place, so many varieties of pin ball magic. It is fantastic...highly recommend. :) One fee at the door and you play all night. Only downside is if it is a super hot day or night, it is quite muggy inside too.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. This museum is great fun and a perfect way to spend a couple of hours (especially if it's raining)We spent two hours playing on the various 1 and 2 player machines without even glancing at our watches.

COMPELLING. Tucked in a back street on the Pest side of the city and quite easily missed as the entrance is a door to a basement. There must be at least 100 plus working pinball machines of all vintages. Time flew. Certainly worth a visit. Be advised it doesn't open until 4.00pm in the afternoon.

Great fun for all ages. Visiting this museum was great fun for me and my partner. It is not actually a museum, as you not only look at the veteran machines, but you get to play with every single one of them. Allow a few hours for the visit.
most amazing place!!!. the place full with hundreds of games and not only pinball. this is a perfect game room and not a museum! must go for two hours at least...

Superb attraction for a few hours . We had a great time at this so-called museum. They have over a hundred pinball machines from the 1940s till today, almost all of them still working and all are free to play. What makes this a "museum" are the details provided near each machine - when was it made, how many of this model were manufactured etc. The history is interesting (especially for the real old machines), the owners are very friendly, and being able to play endlessly was great fun!!

Quirky brilliance . I'm so so glad this place didn't have to close down. The government in Hungary is keen on getting rid of odd little places like this, but it's stayed strong and is attracting tourists from all over. It's literally a museum about the pinball machine, so if you're not into this retro game this attraction probably isn't for you. Note, it's in the 13th district (behind Westend shopping centre) so take a look around whilst you're there. It's still a fairly traditional area with lots of local shops and restaurants. The streets are tree lined and the whizz of the trolley buses is very nostalgic. This museum is an asset to Budapest and a really wonderful thing to still have.

Pinball Galore! Who could ask for more??. Excellent pinball hall with loads of machines!!! This place has a sizable number of some of the oldest playable machines I've ever seen; and I've been to many arcades over the years. The place is great for the entire family. I had a blast!

Very much wanted to visit but closed Mon & Tuesday. Just learned about this as I was reviewing Trip Advisor when we arrived in Budapest (on a Sunday). Sounds wonderful. But unfortunately, like many museums and attractions in Budapest, this one is closed on Monday and Tuesday. We're leaving after 2 days here and I won't be able to visit.
Very sorry about that as it sounds wonderful.

Museum where you can play with the exhibits!. It is basically a big arcade filled with pinball machines from the 1930's up to the present. You pay at the door (reasonable price) and play on what you want for how ever long you want. All the machines are on 'free play'.

A special museum. I was a little scared when my friend told me, that our Friday night spend a museum, but I nodded and did not regret it! It was the best museum, I 've ever been! There are lot of games and you can also play with them! The staff is very professional and helpful, the old pieces can give the museum experience. I can recommend to anyone, who likes to play! (sorry for my mistakes, I don't speak in english very well)Egy kicsit féltem mikor a párom azt találta ki, hogy a péntek esténket töltsük egy múzeumban, de rábólintottam és nem bántam meg! Ilyen tuti múzeumban, még nem voltam! Rengeteg a kiállított gép és mindet ki lehet próbálni! A személyzet nagyon profi és segítőkész, a régi darabok pedig megadják a múzeumi élményt is. Csak ajánlani tudom mindenkinek, aki kicsit is szeret játszani!

Super fun!!. I have no idea how long we spent in the pinball museum...at least 3 hours bit maybe more. It was brilliant! One of the highlights of our trip. When I first read about it, I hadn't realised you could play all the machine so almost didn't go. So glad we ended up there! It's open from the afternoon until late so a great way to spend an evening!

Surprisingly a great deal of fun!. I was a little skeptical about visiting the pinball museum, I have never really been interested in arcade games. I went along with a friend out of interest and was surprised at how much fun it was! we spent a good couple of hours trying the different pinball machines (which are all free, you just pay an entry fee) and you get a little bit of history about each pinball machine. It was a good laugh and pretty good fun.

The most amazing museum!. I went on a free walking tour and this place was highly recommended by our tour guide who is a Budapest local. I did not know what to expect at all at a pinball museum, but what a surprise! Once you walk down into the museum, you're greeted by a man at the counter who is very nice and speaks English. Pay your 2500 florents and you won't regret a thing! All of the games and modified so you can have unlimited turns on them. Honestly, this is one of those places the whole family could go to. There are games as old as 1925 all the way to modern day family guy so there's something for everybody. Once you're on a roll with a game, it's so easy to lose track of time! I spent three and a half hours there and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. I'm so happy this gem of a place was recommended. It is one of the most fun nights I've had in all my traveling.

wow relive your youth. The first thing to say, IT DONT OPEN TILL 16.00.WHEN YOU DO GET INSIDE THIS PLACE IS MASSIVE.And great fun. Once you pay your fee every thing is free!We loved this place and would go back again.The guy who owns it is so friendly and honest its a pleasure to chat to him.I promised him I would write this revue, 11/10 give it a go its a right laught

My youth. When I looked on Trip Advisor and found this place, I had to go there. I am 60 years old and my youth was one giant pinball game. We didn't have IPADS and smart phones. The only drawback was that I arrived at 3pm and didn't realize it didn't open till 4pm. It is a hole in the wall and the ONLY reason to gothere is to play pinball. I tried 6-7 games and finally found one that was really old that was simple to understand how to rack up points and I played it for over an hour. Simple fun.

Fun place!. This was great! About £7/8 to get in and there are loads of pinball/arcade machines that you can play on for as long as you like. Some great 2 player games as well so you can play against each other. Really recommend as something a little different and fun to the other more cultural sights of Budapest!

Brilliant fun. Soo much fun... loved playing on the pinball machines. I wasn't sure what to expect as it said it was a museum but you can be hands on and have fun with all of the machines. Only down side was that they didnt have a bar. We went in the evening and felt that a bar would've made this an ideal place to start the evening and probably would have stayed for longer, that being said we easily lost a couple of hours here

Re live your Miss spent youth..... Very glad we visited this attraction which my husband found while searching trip advisor for things to see in Budapest. It is open fron 4pm until midnight most days. Entrance fee is 2500forints (£5.56 - bargain) and You have to pay in cash. On entry you are given a wrist band and this entitles you to come in and out until midnight. There are a hundred and eighty pinball machines in the museum and your entrance fee means you can play on all of them all night long. My husband and I arrived at 6pm and before we knew it the time was 22.00! We had a great time. The machines are all set to free play so you can try them all or just concentrate on a few to improve your skill. It took us both back to our youth and was a great way to spend an evening at such a cheap price.

Heaven!. This place is amazing! When I walked in I was pleasantly surprised by how many games you could play so I spend the entire evening playing different pin-ball machine and I had great fun! During my trip I visited this place 3 times however it was quite far from were I stayed. I definitely recommend this place if you want to have a great night!

It's a "must" :-) - Kötelező!!!. We used to play with pinball games often at Lake Balaton when I was a child. I really enjoyed it that time, but recently it is not easy to find pinball at ordinary places... When I heard about the museum I became really curious and tried to go as soon as possible. And finally I got there! It is a really great place, lot of game in nice condition, almost all of them works. The location (near Western Train station) is good, easy to find, and you can spend a whole day there without getting bored... Thanks for the owners and pleeeease keep up the good job!Gyerekkoromban Balatonon rengeteget játszottunk flipperekkel, akkor ragadt rám az őrület. Nem is tudtam mennyire, amíg el nem mentem a múzeumba. Zseniális, jó a helyszín, rengeteg gép, és jó állapotban, szépen karbantartva. Köszönet mindenkinek, aki hozzájárult a gyűjtemény illetve múzeum létrejöttéhez, sokunknak szereztek élményteli órákat. Jó volt a nosztalgiázás.

Good fun afternoon out. We attended this with our child for the afternoon. It was a fun experience and great way to entertain a child (took us back to our childhood with all the games). If you are in Budapest with children worth a visit if you have a spare afternoon. Just check the opening times prior to attending.

If only every museum were this much fun!. This was on my list of quirky things to do in Budapest. I wouldn't normally identify myself as a Pinball Wizard, but this place really is amazing. A week later: I'm still wearing the Flippermuzeum wristband with the same braggardly self-righteousness as if I'd been up three nights slaying the mosh-pit at a mud-soaked music festival. Three hours disappeared like I'd been sitting in a pretty girl's lap. This is not entirely coincidental: there were a couple of somewhat ...risqué... machines. However, this is entirely legitimate, as it functions as a bone fide museum. The oldest pinball machine there heralds from 1939. If all museums were this fun, we'd be a highly educated species!

What a Place !. I would have never imagined this to be a good idea but let me tell you it is a load of fun ! This place helps you understand the magic behind the era of the Pin Ball machine which made way for an incredible amount of entertainment.

Great fun, friendly staff and well worth a visit. Decided to visit after reading very positive reviews. It didn't disappoints, it was better than I expected. So many different games to try and not just pinball machines. We spent around two hours playing on the machines, making this place amazing value for money. The staff are friendly and speak good English, which really helped as my Hungarian is, sadly, non-existent.

Excellent way to spend a Saturday night. . Have just visited this place and felt the urge to leave a review. Spent about 2/3 hours inside playing all the pinball machines and games. My girlfriend and I both aged 27 really enjoyed it. We payed around £6 to get in and it open until midnight. The staff where friendly and the place looks great with all the pinball machine lit up. Highly recommend.

Worth a visit!. Price: 2.500 HUF (Adult) / 1250 HUF (Student) - totally worth it. Lots of pinball machines, some quite exotic (ever played pinball facing each other?), all free to play. Some didn't work, but most were in quite a good condition. I used to play pinball in my childhood and indulging in those memories was amazing. My girlfriend, who had never played pinball before, was amazed as well. Staff is friendly. It got a bit crowded in the evening, so try to go there as early as possible.

Blast from the Past fun!. The pinball machine museum has a very large display of pinball machines, shooting range machines, and some video game machines, ranging from 1925 (shooting range machine) to 1980s (Mortal combat). Some of the pinball machines are very retro, and others are multi-layered mindbogglers. After paying the entrance fee to the museum, ALL machines are FREE to play!! This is a most fun "museum", and a real blast from the past. Well recommended!!!

Awesome Experience a the Flipper Muzeum. I wasn't entirely sure what to expect when my boyfriend and I took the metro to this museum, but I am so glad we did. It's huge - there's probably over one hundred pinball machines and similar games that are totally free to play once you pay admission. I thought it was really cool how they had signs on the top of each pinball machine with it's description, year of manufacture, company that produced it, how many were made, etc. My boyfriend had a blast and stayed for 2 hours playing game after game. I highly recommend this museum on a day where you want to take a break from sightseeing, or maybe a rainy day. Oh, they also had cool t-shirts for sale! Overall, I loved this experience - the staff were very nice, and it was a ton of fun!

A trip through memory lane. I love pinball so this was a no-brainer. We arrived about 90 minutes before closing so they were kind enough to discount the admission ticket without our asking. I could have stayed for just the Indiana Jones pinball but walked around and played at least 20 machines. All worked just fine and were very clean. I highly recommend this wonderful place.

Fun fun fun!!!!. We spent over two hours in here without noticing the time passing and only left to obey our growling tummies! The pinball museum 'Flipper' is fun for kids and grown ups. I spent ages trying to get past the first level of space invaders and my husband and daughter played on the mortal kombat 2 arcade game for ages. This attraction is big, from the outside it looked like a relatively small place but there are hundreds of machines in here to play on. Pinball is fun and after a while you'll find a machine you really like and before you know it you're hooked and an hour has passed! There are machines from the early 1900s here and from every decade up to now. You don't appreciate how popular pinball has been throughout modern times but it is displayed here in all its neon glory. This is a must if you have fussy kids to occupy, or fussy husbands!
Fun for at least one hour. If you have one or two hours to spare, just visit this nice museum. It's nice to see something else, and you are able to play on all those 130 machines.

Fantastic, addictive, super fun, Hidden Gem. We spent a week in Budapest and we visited this fantastic place twice during our stay. My husband wasn't really sure about visiting this place as he said that he never really liked pinball machines... (unlike me) ......Until he walked into this place, he quickly changed his mind. The museum is filled with pinball machines, and each and one of them comes interesting facts about model/number of machines produced/year .............some are nearly as old as Queen Elizabeth.. :) Once you pay the entrance fee, which is around £5, you don't have to worry about inserting coins into the machines as games are free. If you go with your friends, I would recommend you play tournaments mode if possible, or just simply challenge your friends to see who scores the most. It's really good fun. You won't find anything else like this anywhere in Europe, so please do not miss this hidden gem.

Could be absolutely amazing, is "just" great.. Really enjoyed my time here but unfortunately it was cut short due to the heat (still quite warm even in an air-conditioned basement, though it was 38c outside - wish the air-con had been more powerful!) - and also because I was nagged by the other half who wasn't really "feeling it".If the museum had a 'nice' seating area / chill out zone / cafe with a bar (or even soft drinks and snacks) I'm sure it would be very popular - as it is, there are a couple of buffets and a nasty vending machine...I still think it's excellent though - just couldn't spend as much time as I wanted there...
Lots of fun!. Lots of fun! We went with our seven year old and four year old boys, they loved it as did my husband! It was a bit hot inside though..

You need see it one time in Budapest. This a great local to take few hours and enjoy more as 100 pinballs. It is a near of the Westend City shopping center. You can travel with metro and walk 10 minutes. We spend 2 afternoon with our doughter, she liked it too. I offer with kids over 10 years.
A time travel to the world of arcades. The biggest pinball collection in Europe, a must see.You can also play arcade videogames and old electromechanical games here.

Brilliant fun. Go. It's so much fun. 2500 Huf for unlimited play. there's loads to choose from 1940s to 90s including lots great ones from the 70/80s - plus an original space invaders machine. Don't go if you have to be somewhere though as time disappears quickly!
Retro. Retro cool and fun to see and experience a good friend from the past the pinball machine. Found a copy of my favorite from my ternageyears :)
You cannot stop. Fantastic place. Wide range of pinballs even from 80's. Be careful because if you start to play and try them one by one you will lost your sense of time.

FUN!!. What a great time! Pinball machines from the 1930's all the way up to modern day, all set for free play and ready to go! I paid a very reasonable flat fee to get in and spent several fun hours just wandering from machine to machine. There were many I'd remembered from my childhood and teen years as well as several I'd never seen before. The great thing about the flat rate was if I found myself getting bored with a particular machine I didn't feel guilty about walking away and trying a different one. Even the guy at the front desk was helpful, calling a taxi for me and making sure I knew when and where it would meet me. Like I said, Great Fun!!

If you like pinball this is heaven . This is a great place, we spent like 4h here playing a lot of different games. If you don't like pinball, but your company does, go shopping instead. This place is impossible to do in half an hour.

One of my favourite places in Budapest. Wasn't too sure what to expect with this pinball museum but my boyfriend wanted to go so why not. It was brilliant, with a student card it worked out about £2/£3 in and all the pin ball games are unlimited usage which was great. if your looking something chill to do in the afternoon defiantly go here!
Go go go. So much fun. Go to see the lights and hear the sounds of tactile gaming. Takes some digging to find, but worth going too. Reminds of something similar in san Francisco.

Awesome. We visited to the Pinball Museum today and spent there an amazing two hours. I haven't had such a fun time for ages. Even my girlfriend who wasn't a fan of pinball beforehand fall in love with the place. Once you pay the entry fee you get to use the machines all day. It's highly recommended!

Vintage Fun!. We stumbled into this place one day having only heard random rumors about it and only having a vague idea of where it even was in the city. It was very much worth the trip. It is very cheap and you pay by the hour so you can play as many games as you want. They have EVERYTHING here. If it's pinball, they have it. I didn't even know I liked playing pinball that much until we came here. Worth a trip!

Flipping Great Pinball :-). Im not particularly a pinball fan and hadn't even played one for over 10 years, but really enjoyed the visit, loved all the artwork and history that comes with the machines ranging from the modern to 1950's pinball machines. Probably enough to keep you entertained for 2 to 3 hours unless your a crazy pinball fanatic then you could stay all day from 4pm til midnight and come out with blisters on your thumbs all for a fixed price of 2500Ft.
Wow. Amazing place for free time.you cant stop playing.i definitely come back to this museum.highly recommended!!!

Stay tuned! it is coming back in August 2015!!!. This was my third visit to this amazing museum. Stumbled across the closed door with CLOSED sign - decided to knock - i was lucky enough to meet the owner. He is a really kind person. has let me in to see - THE NEW MUSEUM IS COMING - Machines are being serviced, bulbs replaces, new games arriving, new rooms opened! STAY TUNED FOLKS - he is going to REOPEN in early AUGUST! I will be back!! :)

Great Time-filler!. I had a couple of hours free between things and saw this place was pretty close to everything (maybe five minutes from Nyugati station tops?). Have never played pinball in my life but was interested in checking it out regardless. Had a blast of a time sucking at pinball games from all periods, seeing the kinds of improvements and gimmicks which were used over the ages, think the oldest machine I saw in there was about 1938 or so and they go right up to the last decade. There's also a fair few other arcade machines, including some videogame systems such as Space Invaders.Could easily have spent another few hours in there and for about €4 (student rate), that's a bargain!Obviously not something you plan a trip around but as a brief diversion (I'd say most people at all interested could get anything between 1-4 hours of fun out of it), it's fantastic!

Brilliant - lets hope it stays open. The authorities are trying to close this place down. let's hope they don't suceed. There are machines from the 30's right up to date and you can play them all for the cost of an extended admission.

Best value and fun activity in Budapest. This little gem is worth finding. A set entry price of around A$10 that gives you unlimited games over a 8 hour period. Three hours just flew by. The range of pinball machines is fantastic, many quite old, and even for those people who may think they're not going to enjoy it, they will find it addictive and fun. The dark, cool room was also a pleasant respite from a 30C day. Sincerely hope the museum can stay as we heard the bureaucrats say it's a gambling establishment and want them closed down.

What a rush! Best place. Ever.. Well, your basic entrance fee lets you in to play any machine for as long as you like. Well, until they close. My daughter had to drag me out, kicking and screaming. I had, after all, just been introduced to Apollo 13, which can release 13 balls all at once. And I knew I still had 100s of games to try. This place is amazing.What I loved the most was seeing all people, of all ages, laughing out loud, giggling, and smiling. Forgetting the troubles of the day.Last, but certainly not least, is the customer service this place offers. I asked for a discount after showing my disability ID. He thought about it for a second and let me in at half price. Later, I noticed his coworker giving helpful tips to everyone.I want one of these in my basement.

Flipping Fantastic. We had a little trouble getting there but once we were inside, awesome! Paying up front for a block of time is so much better than feeding the machines! You can play any machine you want and there are more than I have ever seen outside the US. The gentleman we met at the counter was so very helpful and accommodating. He spoke good English and we enjoyed conversing with him. It was not very crowded so we could play almost any machine without delay! I did not see any machines which were not working! Some of the machines date back to the 40's. It appears to be well maintained and I consider it to be a very well kept secret in Budapest. Even the cruise ship staff had never heard of it before we had asked to arrange a taxi for us! If you like pinball, this is a must do on your trip through Budapest!

Unique Museum. Cool spot with lots of old pinball machines and video games. Really brings you back to your childhood. For about $6 you can play anything you want as long as you want. Worth checking out if you're in the area.

Briliant. I so glad to I have heard about the museum. It was lot of fun.A few hours I went back to my teenager years. There is a big banch of old machine. Nice to see how was the beginning...Good luck guys and keep going. I wish to come back few years time
Lots of pinball machines. There are a wide variety of pinball machines (example Star Wars, Shrek, football, car racing, Pacman, time machine, etc.)

Best £4 I ever spent!. What a fantastic way to spend a few hours out of the sun in Budapest. This was high on my list for places to visit and so glad we made the effort to go. A brilliant collection of pinball and vintage arcade machines all with free play. Always wanted to play the Kiss and Creature from the Black Lagoon machines so one very happy lady indeed! Just be aware it's open from Wednesday onwards. It's been a while since I played so managed to rattle my way through about 40 machines in 90 mins haha. Would have spent a fortune in a normal arcade!
Brilliant . Very unique and quirky place with pinball machines from 1931 until current,definitely worth a visit and plan at least two hours here but you're probably end up staying longer

A very unique museum. This venue is a very unique attraction in Budapest! The museum has an intresting combination of old and modern pinball machines which are available for playing! I played over a 100 different machines ranging from 1930's to this this centry. It was great fun! It's for anybody interested of pinball machines and/or arcades, and it's suitable for all ages.

Amazing find, wish we had one in London. We spent a couple of hours here late evening, amazing value at only 2000 HUF per person (just under £5). Once you're in all of the machines are free. Lots of pinball machines and even Mortal Kombat 2, made me very nostalgic! The fact that I managed to get on the scoreboard for Super Mario Pinball, definitely enhanced my experience! A real gem!
Stumbled across this by accident. Two hours later we were still there! Fantastic selection of pinball machines and games and a very friendly atmosphere.

Great for pinball junkies. The location is about 10 minutes walk north of the Parliament building and a bit to the north of downtown, on the Pest side. It was great. For one price, you can play any of the many, many pinball machines until closing time at midnight. A group of us went, and everyone had a blast. There's a wide variety of machines from different decades, so there's something for almost everybody.
Nice place to time travel. Nice guy at the reception, they can help if you are lost with machines. Interesting games, not only pinball. The soccer and the basketball games I enjoyed the most.
fantastic in friendly environment. fantastic in friendly environment, if it's in any way unique, this place has just about every pinball machine you could imagine

Felt 12 years old again. What a special place to go and have fun for a few hours in the centre of Budapest. The flipper machines are fantastic. Just to hear the popping noises of the machines when you get an extra turn brought back brilliant memories. It's so cheap and you can spend a few hours there as if it was 5 mins . Loved it.

We had a ball!. We visited on a rainy day so it was a day well spent there. They offer student prices at 1000 HUF for over 2 hours which is great. We spent 3 and half hours there and it just flew by. They have Pinball machines from the 20s up to the most recent so lots to get stuck into. Really great fun its a must if your in Budapest.

Those were the days!. This cave museum is offering a wide range of old an newer pinball machines in almost mint and beatiful restorated condition.The playfields are clean and show very little wear and tear, and all but the oldest models can be played for a fixed fee. Nice to do with children on a rainy day. There is a fee for entrance and viewing only, or if you want to play a fixed fee is asked and all 130 machines are set on free play without coins.I liked it very much!!!
Fantastic!. It's a must in Budapest, really amazing museum where I spent 6 hours playing flipper and other games!

Idéal for pinball fans or people with kids. I had a great time there, nice range of pinballs in good to Very good conditions and privons is ok
The owner is friendly and place is tidy
Very pleasant in a saturday afternoon

Time Vacuum. Had so much fun here time seemed to disappear, so make sure you leave enough! They have well over 100 machines in perfect working order with many great classics. The Flipper Museum was an unsuspecting highlight of my trip to Budapest.
Felt like a kid again. This is unique, well as far as I know, and it took me back to my kindergarten years. Its a bit out of the way, in a residential neighborhood, but its worth your time.

Save it for the end. Why? Otherwise you want get to see any of Budapest :)
It sucks you in and suddenly you realize you've been inside for hours.
Never heard of such a museum before and to get to play all of them...my wrists were sore the next day :)

Magic land. A wonderful place, created and managed by pinball maniacs. A great number of machines from the eldest to the high-tech ones. You can spend hours here, kids are mesmerized. Only downfall, that it's a bit loud. Perfect place to spend some time with friends too.

Fun for hours. Pinball museum is great! After paying the entry fee (max HUF 2000, based on the time you spend there), you can not only see a lot of pinball machines (some of them are really unique), but also play with most of them.
If you go there and you love pinball, plan a few hours, because 30 minutes won't be enough...

A lot of fun!!!. I love this place. If you are a pinball fan, this is an absolute must. The owner is a great guy who is genuine in his love for pinball and making it accessible to those lucky enough to live or visit here. While I am typically on a tight time schedule, I have stayed 2+ hours on occasion playing 20+ pinball machines (there has to be at least 60 different machines). I enjoy learning about the specific pinball machine, as most have a bit of background on a information card on top of the display (in English and Hungarian). Great place. Worth every minute. And a great value by the way.Have fun (and don't beat my score on Indiana Jones!)Jeremy
must see!!. Cool place to visit we went on a rainy afternoon great for kids & adults. You can pay to play the machines or free just to have a look around must see!!

Hidden Gem. If you are in Budapest and want something different to do then come to this museum. I wouldn't even say I was that into pinball machines but we were in here for a good 2 hours before I first looked at my watch. Perfect for a rainy day, but also just for something a bit different. They have pinball machines from all eras and we had a lot of fun playing on some of the older ones! The staff were lovely and were very helpful. Great value for money, and you get some back depending on how long you stay! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a bit of fun.

A real time zapper, so much fun!. We visited the Pinball Museum on the our final night in Budapest, and it was brilliant! It's a must for any fan of games and/ or amusements.I went in there expecting it to be just a few pinball machines lying around but it was so much more than that. The pinball museum comprises of a whole range of pinball machines - there must be a couple of hundred of them - from basic 1930s incarnations (with no flippers) right up to more modern day machines, and everything in between. All the classics are there such as 'Ripley's Believe it or Not' and 'Arabian Nights.' Other great tables are 'Star Wars Episode I' (mush more enjoyable than watching the film!) and the Simpsons table. Each exhibit in the museum (i.e. each pinball machine) has a little info card on it stating the year of manufacture, the manufacturer and the designer for that bit of extra info, and each is set to Free Play so you can stay and play on each machine as many times as you want.You pay an entrance fee to get in (500 HUF) and a 2000 HUF deposit, so around £6 in total. For every 15 minutes you stay there, an amount is deducted from the deposit, until the entire deposit is gone. So if you leave after an hour, you get around 1200 HUF back. Although I can't imagine many people leave in time get get any money back, it's far too addictive :-) Once you've gone past your allotted time and used up all of your deposit, you can stay in the place until it closes, and can even go out for food and come back in, as they give you a wrist band on entry.As well as the pinball machines, there are some retro arcade machines such as the original Space Invaders, and some old school amusements such as machines with BB guns to aim at targets.The museum itself is in the basement of a really cool building and has a great atmosphere. There were quite a few people in there when we were in, and the noise of pinballs, arcade machines and people having fun added to the atmosphere. 4 hours flew by, and we only dragged ourselves away because we had to get to the airport for our final hotel check in. If you go, be prepared to give up an entire day to this place!

Definitely come here!. It is only a pinball hall, but if you like pinball with amazing rates its a great way to pass a few hours! Send your partner to the shopping centre at the end of the street if they don't want to tag along. Check their website for opening hours and rates. When back in Budapest, I will be back here!
Awesome!. Best museum ever! Had a great time during the visit. Lots of machines in very good conditions.The staff was helpfull and nice.

Extraordinary. Wow, what a fantastic place!Play as much as you want on machines from the 50`s to date for £5! Having read other reviews was curious to see the Pinball Museum. Tucked away in a residential district in Pest, this little place is enjoyable for little ones (step provided) and adults alike. Not a great pinball fan myself, I had a great time, could not stop trying more machines.
Fantastic. Had a brill afternoon here, noisy but boy was it fun. You will never see so many machines in one place,...anywhere. A great way to spend a rainy afternoon

Remember the good old days of pinball. Very easy to loose track of time in this small place, It's packed full of machines which you can play to your hearts content.One room has pac-man, table football (of a kind) hockey and early tv games, but mostly its immersing yourself in the many twists on basic pinball

Unique and thoroughly enjoyable experience. We went to the Pinball Museum not really knowing what to expect - the next hour and a half flew by and was one of the highlights of our trip. Neither of us are arcade enthusiasts but it would be impossible not to become completely immersed in the huge variety of games the museum has to offer. On arrival you pay an flat entry fee (HUF500) and an additional cost of HUF2000 to use the machines. Use of the machines is charged at HUF200 for every 15mins and you'll be partially refunded from the HUF2000 at the end of the trip based on the length of your visit (and provided you didn't spend over 2.5 hours there!).Even if you're not a massive fan of pinball, don't be put off by the name - there are plenty of other machines, including classic electronic arcade games (Space Invaders, Mortal Kombat), old school shoot 'em ups and mechanical games that date back to the 1930's. I defy anyone to visit this place and not have a brilliant time - there's something for everyone to enjoy!

Fun for everyone. We showed up about 10 mins after opening. We were giving a quick run down of the establishment. Our kids loved every pinball machine they tried. Pricing was reasonable, with kids under 10 being free. We could of definitely stayed there the whole day. Favorite place in budapest for our kids!

Best collection in Europe!. An amazing collection of pinballs available to the public. You can actually play over a 100 pinballs and a number of arcade machines. Parents and kids love it, much more intensive gaming experience than playing on consoles, pc-s or smart phones.A must see in Budapest, do not miss it.

An entertainment oasis. My family and I spent a highly enjoyable afternoon at the pinball museum. It is a bit tricky to find, just look for the circular sign. This subterranean entertainment oasis has a huge variety of pinball machines from all decades. You pay your entrance fee and play as much as you like. Highly recommended!

Amazing. Years disappeared during the 3 (!) hours I played there. From the mechanical of the 50s to the full electronic models of the early 2000, I lost track of time while trying many of the pinballs of my teen age. Do not miss it if you're into games!

Flipping marvellous! . A hidden gem in the heart of Budapest. The curator was extremely helpful, it was very well priced and we had hours of amusement with the vast amount of pinball machines on offer.

Good Fun. We planned to visited here on our trip to Budapest, great fun! not too expensive and just a different thing to do while you are in the city! I would recommend you to pop in and try out the machines

Flipping Marvellous!. I went with my 9 year old daughter and we spent just under 2 hours there having the best time ever.Please be aware that it's closed Mondays and Tuesdays. Open 4pm-Midnight Wednesday-Friday. 2pm-Midnight on Saturday. 10am-10pm on Sundays. It's 500HUF to go in, and you pay 2000 HUF to play as much as you want. The clever thing is, that they refund you at the end depending on how long you've played. You have to play more than 2.25 hours not to get any money back, but at that point, you'd happily pay them again! You can stay there all night if you like for the money you pay up front.They have more machines then you can ever really play, both old and new, as well as a Space Invaders, some shooting games, and our favourite, Sega Basketball (at the very back, furthest point from the entrance).Staff are also really lovely, and friendly. I really can't recommend this place enough. If you've got a heart and like fun, then go here. It's like no other museum I've ever been to!

Enjoyable hour at the end of a busy day. Great fun playing on pinball machines and some other arcade machines. If you like pinball then you'll have a great time but we had enough after an hour.It was relatively easy to find but did need a specific metro journey

Best museum in Budapest!. Amazing array of pinball machines from old to new and all working! We spent a couple of hours there and played on the majority of the machines. Indiana Jones has always been my favourite machine, so was great to see and play that one. Used to play Fun House when I was younger at a camp site in Devon so that was also great! Would recommend a visit to anyone of any age!

Bring back the memories . Hard to find. Its labelled FLIPPER MUSUEM ! once u find the entrance which leads underground. You will be amazed by the collection of pinball machines that are freely available to play for a low price.

Simply Brilliant!. We went here for an hour and a half before dinner- but we definitely could have spent much- much longer! My favourite machine was the Star Wars one- it was awesome!! A must visit for anyone!

A really unique and fun afternoon in Budapest!. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the Flipper Museum last week! So many machines, and a really, really fun way to spend a few hours. The staff were all super friendly and helpful and would chat to you about the machines you were playing if you wanted them to. If I'm ever back in Budapest, this place will be top of my list to return to!

Excellent! Best fun we've had in ages!. This place was fab! Bit of a nightmare to find but once we were there it was just brilliant. The guys were very very helpful, keen to show us everything and even joined in to show us how some of the games machines worked. It was really really cheap as well. We could have spent all night here if we'd found it earlier!

Magical. All I need say is that I came here and felt my feet ache as though I had been climbing a mountain for days, then looked at my watch and realised I'd spent 4 hours playing pinball. I didn't want to leave.

Amazed!. First, we couldn't find the entrance and when we got there it was still closed. So we were bummed that we had to wait. But it was so DAMN worth it. :))It's cheap, it's awesome and it brought us so many good memories from our childhood when we used to go play pimball.They have SO MANY pimball machines. All of them have a brief explanation from when and where it's from. I couldn't choose one to play... but right at the entrance there's this Family Guy pimball that I got addicted to and right next to it there's a The Simpsons one that my boyfriend stayed forever there... and I believe were the newest ones from their collection.And as you walk around you are like "WOW" the whole time, every little space was filled with pimball machines.Of course this is a place that you go to have fun... it's NOT a boring as* museum.We stayed almost for 2 hours but the time flies there. I'm pretty sure if we weren't so tired we would have stayed longer. The staff was so nice! We even got some candy when we left... we really did feel young again.If you ain't going you are REALLY missing it.

Really fun.... so this is the number 1 attraction in Budapest according to TripAdvisor...!I am baffled by this to be fair - given the many other great and well established tourist attractions that Budapest has to offer...Let me assure you though that this is fun... If you want to play Pinball and a few other retro arcade type games this is well worth a visit.The guy on the front desk is really great and softly spoken... He clearly loves pinball and I'm guessing has really got TripAdvisor sussed... As to be fair I would never have found this place without TripAdvisor and I'm still totally mystified how it ranks as no.1 attraction in all of Budapest... However I can't help but recommend this for quirky, unusual and very enjoyable fun... This place does what it says it should... I do think they could really take this to the next level by adding a wider range of old classic arcade games, maybe do a proper cafe to add to it... It's nicely done right now but I implore more people to visit as given more investment and development I think this place is really on to something...Andy
I love this place!. it's not located in the city centre, and the entrance is not the easiest to find, but once you go in, it's magical. I could have spent hours there.

Flipping brilliant. A little off the beaten track, the pinball museum wasn’t to be found in our guide book. However, if you find yourself on the Pest side of the river near Margaret Island, it’s a diverting attraction worth checking out for an hour or two – assuming you like pinball! The collection of pinball machines – and a few other arcade attractions – is vast and dates back to the 1930s if I remember rightly. Most of the machines are playable, and for free - what it costs to go to the museum depends how long you spend there!

Amazing Find. For all retro gaming fanatics this is a must a true gem. It was 2500 HUF entry but if you do not stay for two or more hours you get a partial refund plus I hasten to add that for this price you get FREE play of all the machines!! That's aprox £6 p/p well worth it and a great way to spend a couple of hours winding down after walking around and taking in the sights.

Pinball extravaganza. this is a pinball fan's dream...from old to new there is a wide range of amazing pinball machines all on free play....there were also a number retro arcade games....we had a great night....a must if you want to do something slightly different...also kids will love it.

Amazing, Addictive Place!. Me and my friend came to see this place to take pics, never thought we'll spend hours there actually playing on the machines. Owner is super friendly and so is the staff. there are about over 100 pinball machines dating back in the days to present. There are also many other game machines that are so cool. Very addictive place worth visiting!

for all ages. Its a fun place with older pinball machines to different types with details about design, make, historical information, etc. you'd love it, especially if you are into gaming. Overall a good place to spend couple of hours...

Blast from the past. Called in as it was raining, what a great way to treat tourists. Pay your entrance fee, play around on pinball machines...and a space invader machine. If you don't stay two hours the owner refunds some of your entrance fee. Really enjoyed our 90 minutes.

Out of this world fun!. I cannot rave about this place enough. It was so so much fun! It took me back to my childhood and more. It is packed with so many classic arcade games that you can no longer find anywhere else. The owner was super friendly and helpful. We even bought their t-shirts as souvenirs.

If you like reliving your childhood in arcades then this is the place for you. A huge range of pinball machines to play on from over the last 50 years. It is easy to say the older pin ball machine the harder it is to play. The are also some other antique games that can prove testing. If you get addicted to games then you could spend hours within this establishment.

great way to spend a couple of hours. Brilliant underground pinball cellar with all sorts of pinball machines dating from the originals to modern day. Fascinating to see how they evolved plus it only costs a fiver to get in and have unlimited use on all the machines for two hours. Great fun!
Great!. Spent a couple of hours here and it was fantastic. Loved the pinball machines, not only for playing them but also studying their designs. Staff was very welcoming and friendly.

Great place to go. Lots of Pinball or as Hungarians call them- Flipper machines. Above each one there is a plague explaining when it was made, by whom, where and how many copies. Went there with my husband and was prepared to be so bored as I am not fan of things like this, but I was converted when inside. It is addictive and what a great fun! Not every day you can play on something which was made in 1830! It is not the easiest place to find as even receptionist from our hotel didn't know about it and she lives on the same street, but it is close to Western Railway Station and West End Shopping Centre. Don't miss it when in Budapest and I can guarantee that you will have a great time!

If you are with friends or kids, nice hour to spend!. What a small entrance, hard tot find. But it is worth in when you in there. I had a great amount of fun for an hour and then i was tired. The guy/owner was really nice and helpful. Entrance fee is low paid +-1000 huf each. I recommend this tot anyone!

A must! Bizarre but loads of fun!. Myself and my friend visited be museum and were initially deterred because we couldn't find it anywhere! Turns out it doesn't open until 4pm . . . Keep this in mind.The staff are very friendly and on first instinct we were a little put off (being two young females in a dungeon full of pin ball museums) but we realised they are just VERY passionate about pin ball! Very. And are keen to show you the best machines etc. Worked out very cheap for us as we didn't stay longer than an hour and so you get some of your money back when leaving.There are some excellent machines (namely some of the multiplayer ones) and it's a must if you have time!
A M A Z I N G. love it,very friendly environment,you can stay there as much as you want and play but after a hour and half ,we got a bit tired.Definitely you must visit!

Utterly amazing place!. This place is absolutely fantastic. I spent quite a lot of time here I can tel you! Inexpensive to get in and the staff there are friendly and enthusiastic.I've no idea if it's in any way unique (probably not) but I've never come across anything like it.A further tip is, when you come out and make your way back to the station, you might be feeling a bit peckish. About 100 yards up on the left is a Chinese. Incredibly huge portion and a cola for about £2.50. Doubtful if you could eat it all!

Amazing. This place in amazing, the amount of machines alone is spectacular but the price for what you get is fantastic, 2500 HUF but if you spend less then 2 hours the get partly refunded which i think is genius ad should be done in other place. Its not just the machines the manager her was the nicest bloke you can meet. the machines vary in age which i great seeing how they have changed.only downside was gettng my highscore beaten by my brother which means the machine was clearly broken lol

WOW! Incredible place!. I have honestly never seen anything like this place! We visited the Pinball museum on our last evening just before going out for a bite to eat and it was a great way to spend a hour or two. Over 100 pinball machines, dating back to 1939 all set in a beautiful brick exposed cellar.It's not cheap.. 2500HUF per person.. but you get a refund if you don't stay two hours which is a really lovely touch (we managed 1.5 hrs). A real mix of ages in this place, we are in our twenties, but plenty of older adults about!It puts a smile on your face for sure - would absolutely recommend this place for anyone and everyone! If I'm ever back in Budapest, I'll make sure to re-visit!AWESOME!
It's a unique museum. There are 130 pinball machines and some other games in a very nice cellar. It's not just for your eyes, so you can try them all!

Must visit :). I recommend you to see this pinball museum. There are lots of different pinballs and other games, some almost 100 years old. Prices for museum and playing are not expencive and the owner is very friendly!
Great value for a few hours of fun. Good variety of games, not just pinball - old school basketball game, skittles, 2 player shooting games. Highly recommended if you get the chance to visit!

Great value!. Spent about hour and a half inside, playing around and testing Pinball machines, but also arcade games machines.If you don't want to stay until the closing, or stay less than 2h, they will refund money to you.There is also student discount and these people are very nice! If you don't know how to use some very old machines, they will show you and spend time with you as long as you need their help.The 2h+ stay is priced at 2500 HUF (which is about 8 EUR/10 USD) and as I said, you'll get refund in case of leaving the museum earlier.

Huge smile on my face. Friendly owners, warm atmosphere. This place has just about every pinball machine you could imagine. I'd say there are about 50 machines. Some of these include arcade machines and ultra retro shooting fair games. Machines date back to the 1930s up to 2000s. I'm a generation Y kid who grew up on 90s pinball machines but since I was poor I never had a decent go at them. Now for only 2500ft you can play all day! Just loved it.All the sounds, feeling and smells of a proper pinball parlour. Nostalgia to the max.
Hidden gem!. Wanna have but of fun? Go to the pinball museum! Very friendly staff and lots of great old and new pinball games. It was easy to find too!

Great fun. Everyone who likes pin ball will have the time of their life at the Pin BallMuseum in Budapest. It is easy to find (Close to West End and Nyugati), inexpensive and the staff is helpful and nice to talk to. Recommended!

Best way to spend your evening. This was an underrated place as we hadn't heard anything about it but stumbled across it. The place is full of pinball machines all different and unique! You could spend hours in this place but one of the best things is that if you spend less than 2 hours here you get some of your money back. Bargain for a night of pinball machines!

A must see for pinball lovers. Never have seen so many pinball machines in one location and great working order.It was very welcoming and a lot of fun.The owner was very nice and was able to get us a taxi back to our hotel as soon as we needed one

Amazing! Feels like a time machine. Well, I was a bit sceptic before I went to the pinball museum- why would I pay 2500 fl for a pinball museum and why is it rated so high?! But I think 'pinball museum' does not capture how magical this place is - the owner is extra nice and attentive and all the machines are working. We went in and spent 3 hours in there. It is like a time machine- going back to my childhood but without having to pay for each game. I loved it. Def deserves the rating.
Really?. Whilst there is nothing inherently wrong with this place it cannot be right that it's rated the best place to visit in Budapest as it really isn't.

If you like pinball you'll love this.... Lovely owners happy to talk to you about the history of pinball machines. An amazing collection that stretches back to the 30's. Would have liked some more literature.
Amazing fun. We had so much fun! We stayed much longer than we planned. Recommend this for everyone. The owner is really nice as well :)
So much fun!. Pinballs of all styles and epochs. Dozens and dozens and dozens of them - and you can play all you want, for as long as you want! Great place, tons of fun, highly recommended!
Hilarious experience. Wonderful place to visit, very trippy experience! The staff so lovely and helpful. Seem to love what they do! Highly recommended.
Thumbs up!!!. This place was much cooler than I was expecting. We played a bunch of pinball. Left and went to Aqua World for a while then came back and played more pinball. So great!

Super fun. Came here with two other friends and we had a great time playing the games! You should definitely play if you plan on visiting otherwise you probably won't enjoy it much and will be done within 10mins. They have soo many pinball machines and also other types of fun arcade games! Obviously you should only visit if you are interested in arcade games. But I would definitely recommend it, it is very cheap and so fun.

Epic experience. Although I'm not a big pinball wizard I loved the pinball museum over 130 machines to play on varying from new ones to very old ones from the fifties. You can stay untill closing time for just 2500 forint which is a steal. If you want something to do while in Budapest this is a great excursion.

An exciting journey back in time. Well worth a visit, if not for a longer stay. Not too many places like this exists - even in Europe scale. Have a blast from the past! Try out some pinballs (which there are plenty of), but be warned: you might start to like em! Go with a full belly, as I'm quessing you won't be leaving soon!
Best pinball ever!. This is amazing place! so many great machines in excellent condition and you can not only watch but u can PLAY THEM ALL all day long! For sure i will be back!

A load of balls..NOT. Loved this place, found a little bit off the beaten track, but well worth the effort. Row upon row of brightly flashing techno sounding pinball machines.Great welcome by the Manager who charged HUF 2500 but said if we there fir only an hour or so he would give us half our money back. He did a real gent and PB Expert.I found the Elton John pin ball machine that I had last played in my home town of Masham in John Ellis's chip shop in 1976. Still couldn't get the high score of the week. My mates said it was all in the wrist action... I declined to comment...Yes a must visit even if you have never played a pinball machine...
Amazing!!!. Unique and fun, I think it made my trip... Nice People, good vibes,Special vintage chic! Reminded me of my childhood:)Don't miss out!!!

Great fun. We didn't imagine we'd spend so much time and have so much fun there.We planned to stay for 30 minutes and ended up staying whole 2 hours.The number of machines is endless, 90% pinball machines and the remaining 10% are casual arcade machines like Space Invaders, Pacman, Bowling, kind'a foosball etc..The staff are very friendly and kind. They go around and check the machines every now and then. They also give you tips how to play some of the games.

Love Pinballs? Don't miss this place.. You'll find most of the 'famous' pinball machines in this establishment. One flat fee will get you unlimited playtime on the machines. The pinballs are well looked-after.
130 pinballs!. Great collections of pinballls and other electronic games.Could spend a week here.Clean place,nice staff,very cheap entrance fee
Not bad if you already know Budapest. .....Many other things to see, but still not bad if you like it. It is important to check prices and working hours prior arrival.

A must for anyone who ever played pinball. 130 pinballs in perfect condition.This is the only gaming room in the world where you can try such a quantity.Very friendly owner and staff.The entrance fee is symbolical
Nice owner . We were there on a Wednesday but it was not open. However the owner welcomed us and explained every question we asked very patiently. I'll go there next time I go to Budapest!

Great fun. This place is a gem. Pinball machines from all ages and all set to free play. The staff are friendly and helpful and it costs peanuts too which makes it a fantastic way to while away a few hours when it's freezing outside.

So much fun!!! Definately worth a visit or two!!. This place is amazing!! After paying a small entry free...$10 you get unlimited use of all the pinball and arcade games for as long as you would like to stay (or until it closes at midnight)The owner and workers love their jobs too and come around making sure everyone is having fun and showing how to use older style pinball and arcade games if you have never seen them before!!They have clean snacks and t-shirts for sale and clean bathrooms!!Not open Monday's :( but luckily we had an extra day and definitely glad we decided to go back and try this place out!!! An absolute must stop for a visit to Budapest!!!Make sure you play the basketball n bowling!!! Amazing!!

Very interesting!. There are about one hundred pinball machines of different years and some are really old and well preserved. You can play the machines as long as you like (about 200 hf per 15 mins) and we spent 2 hours there after dinner. Staff are friendly. An interesting activity in Budapest!

Great fun!. Had a great time at the pinball museum. Lots of machines and a few shooters and bowling arcade games. The guy at the desk was so nice, as was the guy wandering round helping and showing how some of the old machines work. Machines are both old and newish, but good retro feel. Would definately go again!

fantastic fun. I went there last Dec 14 at night.It open untill midnight with various pinballs and classic machine uou have ever wish to play.Me and my friend never play a virtual pinball before and I can say that it is worth to play it in real!!The ower very kind and nice, he offer me to look around before I pay.He have very classic machine like 1940-1950 old and it incredibly fun with that old ball to kick it up!!

what a hoot. Read about this on tripadvisor while looking for something else. It's in walking distance of my apartment. I was never much of a pinball player as a kid, but I was quite delighted by this place. I only stayed and played an hour though I paid for the 'all day' just in case I decided to get dinner and then come back. Busy place in a good way. Lots to look at, probably some of you favorite games are there. Just plain fun.
A must see. Over 50 pinball machines! Very good environment and friendly stuff! If you are in budapest you must visit it!

Great getaway. What an amazing place it was. Hundreds of old pinball and arcade games. The staff was nice and kind enough to voluntarily come show us some of the cool games in the back end of the area; check out bowling and basketball! They speak some english too. If you miss the arcade halls go here. All machines are free once you pay entrance.

A must do! :). A really fun and nice place.This place is both museum and "playground" for pinball fans.For a really good price (2500HUF - 16:00-24:00) you can try all the games (all of them in the "free play" mode)And the guys working there are really friendly and keeps the games in a very nice condition.The place and the mashines are really clean.You can feel, that these people put great time and effort to make it NOT like a business, but a place to share their love and interest about pinball :)So go ahead and spend a couple of hours at this place, you wont be disappointed. :)

Awesome night. We decided to visit due to the reviews and it being very close to our hotel. Did not really know what to expect. You pay a very small entrance price and get unlimited goes on literally hundreds of pin ball machines. There are some very old ones and also a few other old arcade games. We ended up staying for close to three hours!

Pinball heaven!!!!. Wow....if you love pinball they you will love this place. Literally hundreds of pinball machines dating from the 60's to present day. Its cheap to get in though i was entirely confused about the entrance fee. Something along the lines of you pay 2000ft to enter and if you leave before the next entry quarter starts then you get your money back. If you decide not to leave then you can stay until around midnight playing pinball for free.There are a few other arcades too....space-invaders. pac-man, street fighter and some awesome bowling, basketball and shooting games from the 60's that are awesome.They did have a cafe but unfortunately it wasn't open at the time. Would be great to have a snack and drink break in between playing.Seriously though, great place which you should try and visit.
I love Pinball!. Best place ever for real pinball lovers. So many machines I could not really decide which one to choose for playing. Really great staff, and perfect place for fun!

Sooo great!. This is perfect place, especially for these cold days, me and my boyfriend enjoyed in playing games. Your cart is valid for the whole day, just check the opening hours. Spend here at least one hour, you won't regret it, it is so great!

Retro Fun in a trendy area!. If you remember the days of arcade playing - you must visit. Enormous underground area with several pin ball machines and other arcade games. We particularly liked the bowling putt game! They do a great deal where you pay and get a wrist band, so you can come and go as you please until 12am. The guy running the place was very friendly - What a great place! - A must see!

Pin it!. Best place ever! Gotta see it to beleive it! And they have Twilight Zone! The classic machines - not just the pinballs but the shooters, pacman etc. - are all good fun and a fun time travel! The kids love it too.Come, come!

Should be ranked in the top!. This place is just amazing and great fun. A bit of retro feeling, but also younger non-pinball generation will enjoy the place big time. Kids are welcome when accompanied by their parents. I live in Budapest and keep going back with an increasing amount of friends being into the place. Go, play, enjoy!

In Budapest? You must see this!. One of the amazing place in this city. Over 150 pinball machines including some arcades. Stay there for couple of hours and you will fall in love in this world of steel ball :)

Great experience. The Pinball Museum is one of the most unique places to go in the hear of Budapest.The galery represents the history of pinball with more than 100 machines from the beginning until nowadays.All the pinball machines are playable ,including the oldest generations.If you need any information about the pinballs,don't hesitate to ask the friendly staff ,they always ready to help!It's a great fun for all the family,including kids,parents and grandparents!

A real curiosity!. PBal Gallery is the only one place in Hungary, where you can find about 130 perfectly working pinball machines, and some other video games related to pinballs.If you know pinballs or don't, you must check this place.It's amazing!Stuff is very kind, and if needed, they can guide you through the pre-machines from the end of 1800's til the classics and nowadays modern pinballs.This is a real must see.

Sommething really special... Great Pinball museum..... I visited several times this place in 2014. Pball Galery has just opened its doors in 2014 and become the biggest Pinball (open)collection all over Europe. After paying some Hungarian Forints (approx 8-9 EUR) you can play unlimited free games on all machines... There are more than 130 pinballs, and of course the biggest names are included, like Indiana Jones, Addams Family or Arabian Nights. If you want some unique experience You can find also some really old games (also in playable condition) and some specialities from the middle of the 20 century.I suggest this place not only for families, but also for party, or just having some fun alone, too....

Most fun in a museum!. We found this place not far from the river in budapest. Nearest metro station is blue line Nyugati Palyaudvar. The its half way down a road called Radnoti Miklos.The staff are very friendly and helpful and speak good english. Nice toilets and clean. We had great fun using all the machines! There are so many. Some really new ones and really old ones plus a few other 2 player games. Best museum i have ever been to!Opening times are 4pm - midnight.

Pinball Time Warp!. During our casual exploration of the city we stumbled upon this side-street gem, home to over 130 pinball machines dating back to the 1930s. All of them are functional and unlimited play is included in the modest admission price. We had a blast in this pinball time warp and recommend it as the perfect distraction from the more recognized sights.
Awesome place. A fine collection of both classics and modern pinballs. The machines are in good conditions and lovely and helpfull staff.
